org.opentcs.util.math

Class GenericMatrix<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentcs.util.math.GenericMatrix<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The matrix's elements' type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Matrix<E>

    public class GenericMatrix<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Matrix<E>, java.io.Serializable
    A matrix containing elements of a generic type.

    This class is basically a wrapper around an array providing convenience methods.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericMatrix(int x, int y)
      Creates a new GenericMatrix of the given dimensions, initially containing only null elements.
      GenericMatrix(Matrix<E> original)
      Creates a new GenericMatrix of the same dimensions and containing the same elements as the given one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears all positions of this matrix.
      static <T> GenericMatrix<T> diagonalMatrix(int dimension, T value)
      Returns a new square matrix of the given dimensions with the elements on its main diagonal all set to the given value.
      static <T> GenericMatrix<T> diagonalMatrix(T[] values)
      Returns a new square matrix with the elements on its main diagonal set to the values in the given array.
      void fill(E value)
      Fills all positions of this matrix with the given value.
      E getElement(int x, int y)
      Returns the element at the given position, or null, if the given position is empty.
      int getXDimension()
      Returns the number of elements on this matrix's X axis.
      int getYDimension()
      Returns the number of elements on this matrix's Y axis.

      This method implements the matrix multiplication.
      void setElement(int x, int y, E value)
      Sets the element at the given position.
      java.lang.Object[][] toArray()
      Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
      <T> T[][] toArray(T[][] array)
      Returns a copy of this matrix as a two-dimensional array.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      GenericMatrix<E> transpose()
      Returns the transpose of this matrix.

      • diagonalMatrix

        public static <T> GenericMatrix<T> diagonalMatrix(int dimension,
                                                  T value)
        Returns a new square matrix of the given dimensions with the elements on its main diagonal all set to the given value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type of the returned matrix.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The X and Y dimension of the matrix to be returned.
        value - The value to set all elements on the matrix's main diagonal to.
        Returns:
        A new square matrix of the given dimensions with the elements on its main diagonal all set to the given value.

      • diagonalMatrix

        public static <T> GenericMatrix<T> diagonalMatrix(T[] values)
        Returns a new square matrix with the elements on its main diagonal set to the values in the given array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type of the returned matrix.
        Parameters:
        values - The diagonal's values.
        Returns:
        A new square matrix with the elements on its main diagonal set to the values in the given array.

      • multiply

        public static <T> GenericMatrix<T> multiply(Matrix<T> a,
                                            Matrix<T> b,
                                            Arithmetic<T> arithmetic)
        This method implements the matrix multiplication. Note: The matrix a has a larger y dimension. This is important for the argument order, because the matrix multiplication is not commutative.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type of the matrices.
        Parameters:
        a - The first source matrix.
        b - The second source matrix.
        arithmetic - The arithmetic used for the elemental operations.
        Returns:
        The matrix resulting from multiplying the two given matrices.
